title: Steve Bruce delighted to see Frank Lampard at Chelsea after fearing top English players would miss out on management
text:
Steve Bruce was relieved to see Chelsea appoint Frank Lampard as manager in the summer as he admitted he feared an entire generation of England’s finest players would miss out on the chance to coach.

Bruce has long bemoaned the lack of opportunities given to young English managers and, like Lampard, started his own managerial career in the Championship and only got a chance in the top flight when he got Birmingham City promoted.

At the age of 58, Newcastle United are the tenth club Bruce has managed in a long career, with varying degrees of success, but was never fortunate enough to be given a chance at one of the elite clubs.

But rather than be jealous, Bruce is delighted for Lampard and impressed with the fact he is willing to put his faith in so many of the London club's exciting young players.

“It’s great to see somebody like Frank given the opportunity,” said Bruce, who has started to look a little more comfortable on Tyneside after the win over Manchester United a fortnight ago relieved some of the early pressure on him.
